answerText: Tsiolkovsky rocket equation [or ideal rocket equation][10] The Tsiolkovsky rocket equation is derived from this equation of mechanics, which states that the time derivative of momentum equals the net force.
heading: NASAT |2013 | 12 | 4 | Science | Physics | College
subject: Science
question: Question: One term in this equation equals the product of gravitational acceleration and specific impulse. For 10 points each: [10] Name this equation which sets the change in velocity equal to the exhaust velocity times the natural log of the ratio of masses. It's sometimes named for Tsiolkovsky.
